channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: The CFPB drops its lawsuit against Capital One, marking a major reversal
item.description: The consumer protection agency also dropped cases against four other companies including Rocket Homes.
item.content:encoded:
The consumer protection agency also dropped cases against four other companies including Rocket Homes.

(Image credit: Kayla Bartkowski/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Laurel Wamsley

item.title: DOGE work could 'cross extreme ethical and legal lines,' says former employee
item.description:
On Tuesday, 21 DOGE employees resigned. NPR spoke to one of them who says she felt the new administration was causing "harm to the American people."

As Elon Musk and the Department of Government Efficiency work to remake the federal government, some of the people tasked with executing his vision have serious concerns about what the changes will do.

For sponsor-free episodes of Consider This, sign up for Consider This+ via Apple Podcasts or at plus.npr.org.

Email us at considerthis@npr.org.
item.content:encoded:
On Tuesday, 21 DOGE employees resigned. NPR spoke to one of them who says she felt the new administration was causing "harm to the American people."

As Elon Musk and the Department of Government Efficiency work to remake the federal government, some of the people tasked with executing his vision have serious concerns about what the changes will do.

For sponsor-free episodes of Consider This, sign up for Consider This+ via Apple Podcasts or at plus.npr.org.

Email us at considerthis@npr.org.

(Image credit: JIM WATSON)

item.title: Katy Perry and Gayle King are heading to space as part of an all-female Blue Origin crew
item.description: The crew was selected by Bezos' fiancée, journalist Lauren Sánchez, who will also be on the brief suborbital flight scheduled for this spring.
item.content:encoded:
The crew was selected by Bezos' fiancée, journalist Lauren Sánchez, who will also be on the brief suborbital flight scheduled for this spring.

(Image credit: Elsa)
item.dc:creator: Manuela López Restrepo

item.title: An abrupt departure as USAID workers return to clear their desks at DC headquarters.
item.description: The Trump administration has been dismantling the US Agency for International Development, and the headquarters have been closed for weeks. But, on Thursday, workers got to go back to their desks - to clean them out and leave.
item.content:encoded: The Trump administration has been dismantling the US Agency for International Development, and the headquarters have been closed for weeks. But, on Thursday, workers got to go back to their desks - to clean them out and leave.
item.dc:creator: Tara Neill

item.title: Data show Tesla sales declined sharply in Europe
item.description: New data out this week shows a sharp decline in Tesla sales in Europe. The company is facing multiple headwinds — including consumer pushback to CEO Elon Musk's political pivot to the right.
item.content:encoded:
New data out this week shows a sharp decline in Tesla sales in Europe. The company is facing multiple headwinds — including consumer pushback to CEO Elon Musk's political pivot to the right.

(Image credit: Odd Andersen)
item.dc:creator: Camila Domonoske

item.title: USAID workers return to HQ to clear their desks, as Trump dismantles the agency
item.description: Workers who served in the U.S. Agency for International Development were allowed a final and brief visit back to their offices to clear out their belongings on Thursday.
item.content:encoded:
Workers who served in the U.S. Agency for International Development were allowed a final and brief visit back to their offices to clear out their belongings on Thursday.

(Image credit: Manuel Balce Ceneta)
item.dc:creator: Michele Kelemen

item.title: Trump says new tariffs will cut U.S. drug deaths but fatal overdoses were already plummeting
item.description: President Trump cited outdated drug overdose data to justify tariffs against Canada, China, and Mexico. He also offered no evidence Canada is fueling the U.S. drug crisis.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump cited outdated drug overdose data to justify tariffs against Canada, China, and Mexico. He also offered no evidence Canada is fueling the U.S. drug crisis.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: Alzheimer's was taking her memory, so she started taking a new drug
item.description: Myra Solano Garcia, who has Alzheimer's, says the drug Kisunla may be one reason she can still drive, cook, and sing.
item.content:encoded:
Myra Solano Garcia, who has Alzheimer's, says the drug Kisunla may be one reason she can still drive, cook, and sing.

(Image credit: Zaydee Sanchez for NPR / @zaydee.s)
item.dc:creator: Jon Hamilton

item.title: Court partially halts Trump's mass firings of federal employees
item.description: A federal judge in San Francisco partially halted the Trump administration's firings of thousands of probationary employees — those in their first year or so on the job.
item.content:encoded:
A federal judge in San Francisco partially halted the Trump administration's firings of thousands of probationary employees — those in their first year or so on the job.

(Image credit: Jacquelyn Martin/AP)
item.dc:creator: Andrea Hsu

item.title: ICE will reopen a major detention center in New Jersey as it eyes a broader expansion
item.description: The Trump administration is expanding its immigration detention capacity, reopening a 1,000-bed detention center in New Jersey and adding beds at other privately owned facilities around the country.
item.content:encoded:
The Trump administration is expanding its immigration detention capacity, reopening a 1,000-bed detention center in New Jersey and adding beds at other privately owned facilities around the country.

(Image credit: ICE via)
item.dc:creator: Joel Rose
